intro: Centaurea poculatoris, commonly known as the sticky centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that give it a sticky texture. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea poculatoris is often used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
